reviews.title: Amazing resort!
reviews.text: Ok, I just got back from my 7 night stay at the Bahia, and promised to write a review on here because it was an amazing holiday. The resort itself is huge and sooo clean, the rooms are perfect and minibars stoked every morning (if you travel with Sunquest you stay in the VIP section with its own office where you checkin/out and get free internet access and our own pool and buffet...
at night the road turns into a huge party with live music/entertainment and lots of drinks! the disco is super fun and the burger joint is open till 7am so you can have a snack before going to bed!
reviews.title: Amazing time, going back for sure

reviews.text: We met lots of people who had stayed at other resorts the week before and they were all amazed with the service and all around cleanliness of the Bahia...people are great, food is amazing (mediterranean and seafood a la cartes were fabulous).....
reviews.title: Will def. go back

reviews.text: i HIGLY reccomend going to this resort, and i plan on going next year!
reviews.title: Okay hotel if you get a good deal
Wonderful Place!
reviews.text: Bahia Principe San Juan was an amazing resort , which is great for all ages. The staff was extremely friendly and the service was excellent. The only problem that my boyfriend and i encounterd with was a german lady stole our towel. I was laying beside the pool and I had my towel under my head tanning, when all of a sudden this german lady came up to me (who didn't speak one word of english) snached it from underneath me and started cursing at me.. ( at least it sounded like it) So me being 19 and her around her 30s she towerd over me. So i went to the front desk, explained the situtation with the crazy german lady and they were happy to give me a new towel. But it gets better, after that she goes up to the front desk and tries to take that towel away from me!! according to the staff memeber she said that I didn't deserve a towel? haha at that point i was laughing and just walked away. Anyways overall the hotel had an amazing club, kareoke bar, and great shops. Oh ya by the way if you enjoy horseback riding they offered it there along the beach for 8 dollars us!! Amazing prices! well anways im telling you now, that you have to check out this place---but im warning you now-------watch out for the towel snachin lady!! haha

We have just returned from our first visit to the Dominican Republic staying at The Bahia Principe in San Juan for 2 weeks. This was a surprise birthday present from my darling hubby and what a gift it was!
reviews.title: Wales to the Dom Republic.
Just Fair
reviews.text: The flight was pretty good travelling with Airtours and all wristbands, beach towel and umbrella cards were issued on the coachfrom airport to the resort which saved time and waiting around upon arrival.
We stayed at The Club Hacienda part of complex and room was clean, comfortable (except for hardest, lumpiest pillows ever) but not quite the 4 star plus advertised.
reviews.title: Great Stay at Bahia Principe

reviews.text: Fridge was stocked with water, beer, Cola light and Sprite but not every day unless requested by telephone. One phone call though and restocked at their earliest convenience. Maid was polite but did not understand any English at all.
reviews.title: Great Resort, but not a 4 Star
Sand Flea Fiesta
reviews.text: Had read reviews but so glad I listened to the better ones and ignored the worse ones, as the holiday was a success and except for minor problems and there was nothing major to complain about.

reviews.title: Bahia Principe - Never a 4*+ Hotel
reviews.text: We have just returned from the Bahia Principe (3rd May 05) having had quite a disappointing 2 week holiday. We definately have no plans to go back!! This is the 4th trip to the Dom Rep for my wife and I and we tried to assure others we met, not to judge the Dom Rep just by this hotel because the others we have been to (Sun Village, Cofresi [twice] & Breezes Punta Cana) were of a far higher standard even though they are only 4* hotels in the brochure.

reviews.title: Loved the Bahia!!
reviews.text: We have been to the Bahia Principe in Costa Adeje, Tenerife, twice and enjoyed ourselves staying in good quality accomodation and good food. That also had a 4*sup rating and deserved it. We expected the same at this hotel BUT WERE VERY DISAPPOINTED!!! I would rate the hotel, as far as the quality of the resort was concerned as 2*+ to 3* at best. Our tour company rated the hotel as 4*+ (based on the facilities provided in the hotel apparently and not the quality of them), but 2 other British companies rated it as 5* with prices to match. True the facilities are there but the hotel was the first in the Bahia Principe Group to be built 10 years ago and it shows it, and the food...well abysmal is all I can say - even our Border Collie dogs would have turned their nose up at some of it.

reviews.title: Don't waste your $$ or vacation time
reviews.text: It is a very large resort spread out along the beach, miles from anywhere. This means that you can have quite a walk to get from some of the rooms to the central pool area where everything goes on and where the main restaurants are located. Also it is about an hour and a half from the Airport and more importantly the Playa Dorada area where most of the hotels on the north of the island are located. This would not be so much of a problem except that most of the trips run by the tour operators start and finish in the Playa Dorada in Porta Plata, meaning that before and after the trip you have a long trip back to the hotel along very bumpy roads. This means that sometimes you have to be catching a bus at 06:30 to take you to start your day trip. Also we knew of a few people who's trip was either cancelled as there were not enough people going from the hotel to justify a bus to get to Playa Dorada or their stay at Sea World was shortened by a few hours because of the length of the journey. (Not the hotels fault but something to bear in mind.) One other problem with the remoteness of the hotel - NO RESTAURANTS ANYWHERE NEARBY TO GO AND EAT A DECENT MEAL AS AN ALTERNATIVE TO THE "FOOD" SERVED IN THE HOTEL.

The pools all could have done with a coat of paint or re-tyling. The first hotel room we had, the paintwork all needed renewing and some guests spoke of the showers having paint coming away from the bath and walls. Our second room was far better and also was not overun by ants as was our first room, but the smoke alarm fell off the ceiling onto my wife during the night (stuck up with only double sided tape and more importantly...NO BATTERY IN THE ALARM and it was not a mains powered one!!). The first room was on the ground floor and this may have contributed to the problem with the ants because they would not go away even though the staff sprayed the room on atleast one occasion. I would sugest if you are going to the hotel you request an upstairs room as we were not the only ones with ant problems.
reviews.title: Four Amigas From Vancouver, BC ~ AN ABSOLUTE BLAST!!!!

reviews.text: BEWARE - They are starting to spruce up the main pool on 7th May and it will be closed for atleast a month so guests will be forced to go to one of the 2 smaller pools and if the hotel is only a 3rd full they will be REALLY busy and full of people as they are not very big at all. Our "My Travel" rep told us that they are going to be resurfacing the main pool and surrounding area and also improving the childrens club area. As the buffet & Mexican restaurant, Piano Bar, and 2 other Bars are all surrounding the main Pool, I would imagine these will get very noisy and dusty while the work is going on. My Travel are not putting anyone in the hotel while this work is going on but I do not know about other tour operators from the UK or elsewhere. If you are offered a move to another hotel instead, either before arriving at the airport in Porta Plata or when you arrive, my advice would be to take it if the thought of this work going on around you with the accompanying noise might bother you, or if my comments below give you any cause for concern.
reviews.title: Amazing Vacation!!!
Good Vacation
reviews.text: Just came home from a week at the Bahia, and overall had a great vacation. After reading some reviews, I was very nervous about going, but after staying there a week I can say that there really was nothing to worry about. There were some minor inconveniences on our vacation, but nothing to worry about really.

reviews.title: Great time at the Bahia!!!!- 2 girls from Stoney Creek, Ontario, Canada
reviews.text: Flew with Air Transit, and had a great flight. Vacation Rep met us in the airport, and took us to the resort without incident. Check-in at the resort was very disorganized - we didn't get our braclets on the bus, and we arrived early in the morning and check-in isn't until 3, so we had to leave our luggage unattended, and carry our carry-ons with us on the beach. Check-out was just as inconvenient- we were told to check out at 4:30 am, and we didn't leave the resort until after 6 am. Also, there was supposed to be a continental breakfast, but we never say any. Minor inconvenience.

reviews.title: Nothing special - Wouldn't go back again
reviews.text: The rooms are basic, but very clean and no bugs to be seen. We didn't spend much time in them, so it was no big deal!

reviews.title: Had a blast - even in the Rain
reviews.text: Was really impressed with the food...the buffet selection was really good, with different things every day. Omlettes were great for breakfast! We ate at three A La carte's - Italian, Meditranian, and Mexican. They were all quite good, but Mexican was my favourite!
The hotel grounds itself are quite beautiful, and there is never any garbage to be found! The pool area is great to relax by, and there was usually no trouble finding a chair to lie in!
